perturbation.original_text:
(vi) "MANUFACTURING OUTSOURCING SERVICES" - Certain turnkey based           purchasing, manufacturing, testing, configuration and delivery           services for the Products all as detailed in the Agreement and its           Appendices and Exhibits, including but not limited to: purchase of the           Product's components which are not supplied by NICE, assembly and           production of the Products subject to supervision, control and           planning by NICE, execution of Measurements and Procedures, response           times, providing infrastructure and resources, allocation of the           required manpower, use of the Non Generic Equipment, execution of           engineering and integration process, Engineering Changes, integration           of NICE Software, implementation of Control and Planning, Engineering           Changes and Change Order procedures, packaging requirements,           dismantling and disassembly of Products procedure, spare part           mechanism, quality control requirements, logistics management           including inventory management, adjusting and meeting forecasts,
           components purchasing procedure, supplies and shipment schedules,
           issuing orders procedure, preparing export shipments, all of world
           class quality and capability and as provided herein, on a turnkey
           basis, and acquisition from NICE of certain inventory related to the
           operations to be outsourced, and to contract with certain of the
           contractors supplying components and/or performing portions of the
           remainder of work or to accept assignment of such contracts, all as
           detailed herein.
perturbation.changed_text: (vi) "MANUFACTURING OUTSOURCING SERVICES" - Broad support activities encompassing some purchasing, partial manufacturing, basic testing, limited configuration, and occasional delivery assistance for the Products as referenced in the Agreement's high-level descriptions. These services might cover minimal component procurement when NICE doesn't supply them, potential product assembly depending on current needs, simple product tests, elementary configuration steps, and helping with sporadic deliveries, all under general NICE guidance. The services also touch on providing limited infrastructure, using some shared equipment, following general change processes, addressing basic packaging, and handling basic logistics, subject to NICE's direction and resource availability.
perturbation.explanation: By using vague and non-specific descriptions, the modified definition creates ambiguity and conflicts with the detailed list of responsibilities provided in the original definition. The term 'Manufacturing Outsourcing Services' is meant to create uncertainty about the true scope of the outsourced services.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Ambiguous terms can lead to unenforceability due to a lack of mutual understanding.

perturbation.original_text:
(xi) "NICE PROPRIETARY INFORMATION" - Any and all data and information           disclosed by NICE to the Contractor during the term of this Agreement           in any form, whether verbally, in writing or in machine readable form           or in magnetic media, relating to the business, manufacturing,
           know-how, Products, NICE Software, any other products, items,
           components and affairs of NICE including its Affiliates, and including
           without limitation - documents, prototypes, samples and the NICE'
           plants and equipment, Products, certain proprietary and confidential
           information concerning NICE' past, present and future research,
           development and business activities and the results therefrom,
           including but not limited to digital recording solutions, applications
           and services technology. Proprietary Information may also include
           information disclosed to NICE by third parties.
perturbation.changed_text: (xi) "NICE PROPRIETARY INFORMATION" - Limited information, potentially disclosed by NICE to the Contractor, possibly in written form, loosely related to NICE's general business operations and select products. This might include basic documents and high-level product overviews. Information NICE gets from others might also be considered.
perturbation.explanation: The revised definition introduces conflicting interpretations by making the scope of "NICE PROPRIETARY INFORMATION" uncertain and limited. This misaligns the term by contradicting the comprehensive protection intended in the original definition.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secret Law - Vague definitions of proprietary information make it difficult to claim trade secret protection.

perturbation.original_text:
(xii) "INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY" - Trademarks, trade names, logos, domain           names, designs, patents, copyrights, inventions, discoveries,
           technology, know-how, trade secrets, confidential and proprietary
           information and mask works, all registrations and applications for any
           and all renewals, reissuances and extensions of, and all goodwill in,
           the foregoing.
perturbation.changed_text: (xii) "INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY" - General branding elements, possibly including trademarks and logos, and some basic designs. Could also cover general know-how.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces legal uncertainty by narrowing the definition of "INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY" to branding elements, while omitting key aspects like 'patents', 'copyrights', and 'trade secrets'.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual Property Law - A limited definition jeopardizes protection by excluding legally recognized forms of intellectual property.
